availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Lawrence Marshall (Nelson County, Kentucky, cabinet maker.)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, cabinetmaker. Delaware native. Son of Samuel Marshall and Elizabeth Marshall. Married to Melvina O. Cox Marshall in Nelson County in September 1838. Father of Sarah Marshall, Christina Marshall, Melvina Marshall, and Kate Marshall. Married to Elizabeth Marshall in Nelson County on October 11, 1853. Father of Edward T. Marshall and Charlotte Marshall. Cabinetmaker in Nelson County in 1850. Employed J. R. Strange as a cabinetmaker, Thomas Milligan as a clerk, and Henry Brenner as a carpenter in Nelson County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Nelson County in 1850. Cabinetmaker in Nelson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
